--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, =
Harbir Singh Hundal <hshundal@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Frank!
>  I have used JUNI=
T in testin the webapplication, and it did a great
job for me, well the tim=
e increase for testing the application does
not increase considerably, and =
it will depend the way the testing is
carried, if testing is considered in =
the initial phases, then it is
likely to take less, rather than incoorporat=
ing it at later stages.

[Frank] I cannot agree with you more in that doing=
 it at the beginning
would make it much easier. Actually, i have been revie=
wed some of the
code my team wrote. Since no one really thought about testa=
bility, it
is very difficult to ADD testing code unless we can do big
refac=
torying, which is impossible for our case. 


>  One best use of JUNIT I ha=
ve found is that the major test can be
run during the start-up of the appli=
cation, which is a nice feature,
and it reduces lot of surprises.
>  Well, =
this is all I am say about JUNIT, in my view, I think JUNIT
definitly has l=
ong term benefits.
>

s for sharing. :)

Cheers,
